Package imagingbook.pub.edgepreservingfilters

Class BilateralFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • imagingbook.lib.filters.GenericFilter2D
      • imagingbook.pub.edgepreservingfilters.BilateralFilter
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BilateralFilterSeparable
    public class BilateralFilter
extends GenericFilter2D
    This class implements a bilateral filter as proposed in C. Tomasi and R. Manduchi, "Bilateral Filtering for Gray and Color Images", Proceedings of the 1998 IEEE International Conference on Computer Vision, Bombay, India. The filter uses Gaussian domain and range kernels and can be applied to all image types.
    Version:
    2013/05/30

    • Method Detail

      • filterScalar

        protected float filterScalar​(ScalarAccessor ia,
                             int u,
                             int v)
        Description copied from class: GenericFilter2D
        Calculates and returns the filter result for a single pixel at the given position in a scalar-valued image. Concrete filters must implement at least this method.
        Specified by:
        filterScalar in class GenericFilter2D
        Parameters:
        ia - the ScalarAccessor representing the source (scalar-valued) image
        u - the horizontal pixel position
        v - the vertical pixel position
        Returns:
        the resulting (scalar) pixel value for the specified image position

      • filterVector

        protected float[] filterVector​(ImageAccessor ia,
                               int u,
                               int v)
        Description copied from class: GenericFilter2D
        Calculates and returns the filter result for a single pixel at the given position in a vector-valued image. This also works if the image is scalar-valued, i.e., has only a single component. The method implements the default behavior, where the same filter is applied to all component channels. Concrete filter classes should override this method if a different behavior is required.
        Overrides:
        filterVector in class GenericFilter2D
        Parameters:
        ia - the VectorAccessor representing the source (RGB) image
        u - the horizontal pixel position
        v - the vertical pixel position
        Returns:
        the resulting (RGB) pixel value for the specified image position
